motifs.label: LH long-bass + sustained chord bed
motifs.description: Left hand sustains a low bass (often dotted-half) with a mid/high chord (often half) after a quarter rest; aim for calm, even resonance.

motifs.label: RH lyrical 3-note contour
motifs.description: Right hand often moves in simple stepwise/neighbor motion across each bar; shape as one long phrase, not separate notes.

motifs.label: RH tie/sustain across bars
motifs.description: Melody note ties (or long holds) across measures; keep pulse steady while the hand stays relaxed and the sound stays alive.

motifs.label: Color notes (C natural / F natural) section
motifs.description: Accidentals (notably C-natural and F-natural) change the color; confirm fingering and ear-training for the altered scale degrees.

motifs.label: Ritard + final soft landing
motifs.description: End-game control: slow down (rit.) without losing tone, and place the final chord with full calm resonance.

teacherHints.goal: Make the LH bass and upper chord bloom gently with no bumps in the pulse.
teacherHints.counting: Count 1-2-3; keep beat 1 calm even though the chord enters after the rest.

teacherHints.goal: Repeat the intro with identical tone and timing.
teacherHints.counting: Same 1-2-3; aim for the same breath between beats 1 and 2.

teacherHints.goal: Bring out RH line (F#–A–G–F#–C#) while LH stays like a cushion.
teacherHints.counting: Each measure: 1 (rest/chord setup) 2-3 (sustain). Keep RH aligned to beats.

teacherHints.goal: Let the phrase land on the long A without slowing down early.
teacherHints.counting: Keep 1-2-3 steady; A in m.8 is held—don’t let the tempo droop.

teacherHints.goal: Hold the RH F# calmly while the harmony shifts underneath.
teacherHints.counting: Count 1-2-3 in both bars; RH stays relaxed—no re-strike on the tie.

teacherHints.goal: Keep the held RH note alive through two more harmonies, ending cleanly.
teacherHints.counting: Quiet metronome in your head: 1-2-3, 1-2-3.

teacherHints.goal: Play like a second stanza: same melody shape, slightly more confident tone.
teacherHints.counting: Keep the same bar-length breathing as before.

teacherHints.goal: Mirror N4’s landing but keep it flowing forward into the next section.
teacherHints.counting: Don’t slow down on m.16—just soften.

teacherHints.goal: Keep RH singing while LH bass changes (F#2, then very low B1).
teacherHints.counting: Same 1-2-3. Keep the rhythm steady even with the deep bass.

teacherHints.goal: Let the RH E (held) float while harmony shifts (E–G–B then E–B–D–G).
teacherHints.counting: Count through the tie; avoid re-articulating.
commonMistakes: LH chord arrives unevenly after rest

nuggets.label: Color change: F natural chord + C natural (m.21–22)

teacherHints.goal: Hear the new color (F natural in LH harmony; C natural in RH) and keep the crescendo smooth.
teacherHints.counting: 1-2-3; place each RH note exactly on the beat.
commonMistakes: playing C# instead of C natural

teacherHints.goal: Keep the RH line connected as it descends; keep LH changes silent and even.
teacherHints.counting: Steady 1-2-3; no rushing the second bar.

teacherHints.goal: Hold RH D smoothly while the harmony shifts under it; keep it calm, not static.
teacherHints.counting: Count through the tie; release exactly at the phrase boundary.

teacherHints.goal: Project the rising RH line clearly while keeping LH extremely soft.
teacherHints.counting: Each RH note on a beat; no extra accents.

nuggets.label: Return to mp then soften, tie returns (m.29–30)

teacherHints.goal: Let the phrase relax without losing the beat; keep the RH line legato.
teacherHints.counting: Stay strict with 1-2-3 while dynamics taper.

nuggets.label: Tie resolves, reset into new phrase (m.31–32)

teacherHints.goal: Release the tie cleanly, then re-enter the line with a gentle lift.
teacherHints.counting: Count the release on the barline; don’t clip the sound early.

teacherHints.goal: Support the RH with a controlled swell while keeping the deep bass gentle.
teacherHints.counting: Keep strict 1-2-3; deep bass should not pull the tempo.

teacherHints.goal: Keep RH line clear while LH harmony becomes brighter; then taper into the next texture.
teacherHints.counting: Feel two-bar arc: bar 1 up, bar 2 down.
whatToListenFor: smooth handoff into the next nugget

teacherHints.goal: Voice the top melody while the added inner notes stay extremely soft.
teacherHints.counting: Keep bar-length steady; avoid ‘waiting’ for the added chord tones.

teacherHints.goal: Place the chord cleanly, then let the texture disappear into the next silent RH bars.
teacherHints.counting: Count through the silence; the pulse continues even when RH rests.

teacherHints.goal: Keep the same sound world while RH is silent—no tempo drift.
teacherHints.counting: Count 1-2-3 with conviction; imagine the melody above.

teacherHints.goal: Restart the singing line smoothly (no ‘jump scare’ entrance).
teacherHints.counting: Enter RH exactly on beat 2 of m.44 (after the initial rest-bar feel).
whatToListenFor: same phrasing as earlier theme entries

teacherHints.goal: Let the phrase taper naturally; keep the RH line connected.
teacherHints.counting: Two-bar phrase: breathe only at the end.

nuggets.label: Tie on A, then long F# tie starts again (m.47–48)

teacherHints.goal: Hold the long notes without re-attacks; keep the accompaniment perfectly even.
teacherHints.counting: Count through the held notes; feel the harmony change under a stable melody.

teacherHints.goal: Maintain tone and tempo through repeated harmonic cycles under the tie.
teacherHints.counting: Metronome-in-head: 1-2-3, 1-2-3; nothing changes in pulse.

teacherHints.goal: End the sustain cleanly and restart the melodic gesture without a bump.
teacherHints.counting: Release exactly on time; the next bar’s beat 1 should feel the same pulse.

teacherHints.goal: Soften while keeping the line connected (B–C#–D then A held).
teacherHints.counting: Don’t shorten the held tone; keep counting through it.
commonMistakes: losing tone on the held note

teacherHints.goal: Keep the atmosphere; the bass changes should feel like a slow wave, not an event.
teacherHints.counting: Count steady; treat deep bass as part of the same pulse.

teacherHints.goal: Hold the tied E calmly while LH harmony remains stable and soft.
teacherHints.counting: Count through the tie; no re-attack.

teacherHints.goal: Keep the held E while the harmony turns darker (F natural in LH).
teacherHints.counting: Stay strict with 1-2-3; no slowing during the color change.

teacherHints.goal: Re-establish the colorful rising line with clean C naturals.
teacherHints.counting: Each RH note is a beat; no rushing the second bar.

teacherHints.goal: Taper the line and begin the tied D without changing tempo.
teacherHints.counting: Keep counting through the tie start on m.64.

teacherHints.goal: Release the tie cleanly and shape the new rising gesture without overplaying.
teacherHints.counting: Release on time; keep beat 1 calm in the next bar.

teacherHints.goal: Make the C natural unmistakable, then taper without dragging.
teacherHints.counting: Two-bar phrase: keep it moving, just softer.

teacherHints.goal: Hold the tied D without re-articulation and keep the accompaniment smooth.
teacherHints.counting: Count through the tie; aim for identical timing on LH entries.

nuggets.label: G then F natural long tone (m.71–72)

teacherHints.goal: Sustain the long tones and confirm F natural color in both hands.
teacherHints.counting: Stay steady; don’t ‘park’ on the long note.

teacherHints.goal: Place every accidental correctly while tapering; keep the melody clear.
teacherHints.counting: Each RH note on the beat; the softening should not change timing.

teacherHints.goal: Keep the top line while inner tones remain whisper-soft; prepare the slowing without doing it yet.
teacherHints.counting: Keep strict 1-2-3; save the ritard for the next nugget.

teacherHints.goal: Slow down naturally (as marked) and place the final D-minor sonority with complete calm.
teacherHints.counting: Count longer beats as you slow: 1…2…3… then final bar 1…2…3… with a relaxed release.
